newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products - gas oil and fuel firming.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products - gas oil and fuel firming.

text.p: Med oil products were mixed on Wednesday, traders said.
Gasoline was weaker as NYMEX futures eased. Interest was seen for Turkey and other destinations in the Black Sea.
Naphtha was softer as crude futures slipped. A Spanish refiner sold a heavy Algeciras cargo to an undisclosed party in the Med on Tuesday, at a p+c price.
Material remains scarce, with maintenance at the Skikda refinery sapping supply, but demand is limited too.
Gas oil was steady to slightly stronger although buyers and sellers appeared to be distanced.
There was talk of at least four Russian cargoes hitting the Med before the end of August. Bids were put at quotes cif hi +50 cents, basis Genoa and offers at quotes cif hi +$2.0.
Traders said a Turkish tender for two plus one optional 25,000 tonne cargoes would mop up some of the material.
A Libyan cargo of low sulphur material was also due to load Sept 8-10. Traders said it was being offered at quotes cif high +$4.50 fob Ras Lanuf.
High sulphur cracked fuel oil was seen to be getting tight in the Med supporting a move for higher prices.
Tender news dominated on Wednesday with Cepsa winning the Portugese tender for 30,000 tonnes loading end August and Tunisia withdrawing its 100,000 tonne buying tender.
Egypt's EGPC announced a tender that closes on September 2 to sell up to 11 cargoes of high sulphur cracked fuel. The tender will be announced on September 5.
A major was heard offering a 30kt straight run Tuapse cargo at high cif Med +$7. Some traders thought the price about $3 off the market.
A high sulphur cracked bunker spec cargo was sold at high cif Med plus below $1.
